description.para:
Every one of these returns a request object that must be used to specify further options for the request. See docs for the relevant request objects for details.
All methods present here look up the resource in the current node's namespace, i.e. registry.currNameSpace().
We explicitly prohibit creating resources in any namespace but the current node's one.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new resource at node execution time. The resource will be provided by FG before the node starts executing.

parameterdescription.para: A unique name identifying this resource within the current node's namespace.

Specifies the way in which history should be handled for this texture. A history for a virtual resource is a physical resource that contains the data this virtual resource had at the end of the previous frame. See dabfg::History for details.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new texture at node execution time, which will not be FG-provided, but acquired from the callback before the node starts executing and stored somewhere outside. Note that history is not supported for external resources.

parameterdescription.para: A unique name identifying this resource within the current node's namespace.
A callback that maps a multiplexing index to a ManagedTexView.

briefdescription.para: Reads the history of an existing resource at node execution time.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the resource the history of which to read.

briefdescription.para: Modifies an existing resource at node execution time. Modifications always happen after creation and before all reads.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the resource to modify.

briefdescription.para: Modifies an existing resource at node execution time, but indirectly, through a "slot", which must be specified with dabfg::fill_slot. Modifications always happen after creation and before all reads.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the slot to be used for this modification.

briefdescription.para: Reads an existing resource at node execution time. Reads always happen after all modifications and before the renaming.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the resource to read.

briefdescription.para: Reads an existing resource at node execution time, but indirectly, through a "slot", which must be specified with dabfg::fill_slot. Reads always happen after all modifications and before the renaming.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the slot to be used for this read.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *from, const char *to, History history) const
memberdef.name: rename

briefdescription.para: Modifies and renames an existing resource at node execution time. Renaming always happens last among all operations on a resource. The renamed version is considered to be a new virtual resource.

simplesect.para: Parameters from and to are looked up in different namespaces when calling this function on an arbitrary NameSpaceRequest object! Current node's namespace is used for creating to, while from is looked up in the current request object's namespace!

parameterdescription.para: Old resource name. Note that this resource may not have history enabled, as renaming it "consumes" it on the current frame, so it is not possible to read it on the next one. It will be looked up relative to this namespace.
New resource name, created inside the current node's namespace!
Whether the new resource needs history enabled, see create for details about history.

briefdescription.para: Alias. See create function for details.
Alias. See create function for details.
Alias. See modify function for details.
Alias. See modify function for details.
Alias. See modify function for details.
Alias. See read functions for details.
Alias. See historyFor function for details.
Alias. See read functions for details.
Alias. See read functions for details.
Alias. See historyFor function for details.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *from, const char *to, History history) const
memberdef.name: renameBlob

briefdescription.para: Alias. See rename function for details.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *from, const char *to, History history) const
memberdef.name: renameTexture

briefdescription.para: Alias. See rename function for details.
Orders the current node before a certain node. This means that the node name will only start executing after the current node has finished.

simplesect.para: Ordering with nodes from different name spaces is not supported.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the node to order before, looked up in the current namespace.

briefdescription.para: Alias for calling orderMeBefore(const char *name) several times.

parameterdescription.para: List of names of the nodes to order before.

briefdescription.para: Orders the current node after a certain node. This means that the current node will only start executing after node name has finished.

simplesect.para: Ordering with nodes from different name spaces is not supported.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the node to order after, looked up in the current namespace.

briefdescription.para: Alias for calling orderMeAfter(const char *name) several times.

parameterdescription.para: List of names of the nodes to order after.

briefdescription.para: Sets a priority for this node that will be used to order parallel nodes. Should only be used for optimizations.

parameterdescription.para: The priority to set.

briefdescription.para: Choses multiplexing mode for this node. Default is multiplexing over all axes (i.e. normal world rendering).

parameterdescription.para: The multiplexing mode to set.

briefdescription.para: Sets the side effect of the node that will control how the framegraph handles execution.

parameterdescription.para: The side effect type to set.

briefdescription.para: Requests a certain global state for the execution time of this node.

simplesect.para: A builder object for specifying concrete states.

briefdescription.para: Requests that this node is going to be drawing stuff, which is always done inside a (possibly implicit) render pass. The returned object allows fine-tuning the render pass.

simplesect.para: A builder object for specifying attachments and other details of the render pass.

briefdescription.para: Returns a request object for this node's name space that can be used to get sub-namespace request objects or request resources.

simplesect.para: NameSpaceRequest object representing the current name space.

briefdescription.para: Returns a request object for the root name space which can be used to access global resources.

simplesect.para: NameSpaceRequest object representing the root name space.

briefdescription.para: Get a request object for the resolution of a particular type inside of this namespace, which can then be used to create textures or be resolved into an actual number at execution time. The resulting resolution will be the product of what was set with NameSpace::setResolution with the multiplier.

parameterdescription.para: Auto resolution type name.
A multiplier for the resolution type.

simplesect.para: AutoResolutionRequest Object representing the auto resolution type.

briefdescription.para: The main builder object for describing at declaration time what your node intends to do at runtime.
